text: Therefore \add when we\add*\ef + \fr 3:1 \ft ﻿*Here “\add when\add*” is supplied as a component of the participle (“could bear”) which is understood as temporal \ef* could bear \add it\add* no longer, we determined to be left behind in Athens alone,
and we sent Timothy, our brother and fellow worker for God in the gospel of Christ, in order to strengthen and to encourage you about your faith,
\add so that\add* no one would be shaken by these afflictions. For \add you\add* yourselves know that we are appointed for this,
for indeed when we were with you we told you beforehand that we were about to be afflicted, just as indeed it happened, and you know.

Because of this, I also, \add when I\add*\ef + \fr 3:5 \ft ﻿*Here “\add when\add*” is supplied as a component of the participle (“could endure”) which is understood as temporal \ef* could endure \add it\add* no longer, sent in order to know your faith, lest somehow the tempter tempted you and our labor should be in vain.

But now, \add because\add*\ef + \fr 3:6 \ft ﻿*Here “\add because\add*” is supplied as a component of the participle (“has come”) which is understood as causal \ef* Timothy has come to us from you and has brought good news to us of your faith and love, and that ⸤you always think kindly of us⸥\f + \fr 3:6 \ft Literally “that you have kindly remembrance of us always” \f*, desiring to see us just as also we \add desire to see\add* you,
because of this, brothers, we have been comforted because of you in all our distress and affliction through your faith,
because now we live, if you stand firm in the Lord.
For what thanks can we repay to God concerning you, because of all the joy \add with\add* which we rejoice because of you before our God,
night and day praying beyond all measure that \add we\add* may see your face and complete what is lacking in your faith?
Now \add may\add* our God and Father himself and our Lord Jesus direct our way to you,
and \add may\add* the Lord \add cause\add* you to increase and to abound in love for one another and for all, just as also we \add do\add* for you,

so that your hearts may be established blameless in holiness before our God and Father at the coming of our Lord Jesus with all his saints.\f + \fr 3:13 \ft Some manuscripts have “his saints. Amen.” \f*
